sys_hub_action_type_definition.description:
This action retrieves all Transitions information from the given Issue ID in JSON format from Jira Cloud Instance.

Inputs:

  • Connection Alias - Connection Alias Record you wish to use in the action.
  • Issue ID - ID or key of the issue to transition.

Outputs:

  • Status - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.
  • Error Message - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.
  • Jira Transitions - Will be set to transitions information retrieved from Jira REST in case of success.

Error Messages:

  • Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it.
  • Unauthorized - Incorrect username and / or password.
  • Either the URL to the Jira Cloud instance is incorrect or the server is unreachable or down.
  • The Jira instance is unreachable or down as the request timed out.

Additional Notes:

  • Every project in Jira has a workflow defined which consists of a set of states and transitions. Issues change states during their lifecycle by user action. Issues can be transitioned only into allowed states.
  • For example, for default project there are three pre-defined states: Todo, In Progress, Done.
    • In this example, workflow has following transitions available:
    • ToDo -> In Progress
    • In Progress -> ToDo or Done
    • Done -> In Progress

To use this action, the corresponding Jira connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jira Connection & Credential alias.

Note: Requires a subscription for production use. Read More.
sys_hub_action_type_definition.name: Look Up Transitions

03:58:07Successpublicfalse3f5d8d4edbe897005963ff041d9619d2<p>This action retrieves all Transitions information from the given Issue ID in JSON format from Jira Cloud Instance.</p> <p><b>Inputs:</b></p> <ul> <li><strong>Connection Alias</strong> - Connection Alias Record you wish to use in the action.</li> <li><b>Issue ID</b> - ID or key of the issue to transition.</li> </ul> <p><b>Outputs:</b></p> <ul> <li><b>Status</b> - Will be set to “Success" if the request succeeds or “Error" if a failure occurs.</li> <li><b>Error Message</b> - Will be populated when the status is “Error”.</li> <li><b>Jira Transitions</b> - Will be set to transitions information retrieved from Jira REST in case of success.</li> </ul> <p><b>Error Messages:</b> </p> <ul> <li>Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it.</li> <li>Unauthorized - Incorrect username and / or password.</li> <li>Either the URL to the Jira Cloud instance is incorrect or the server is unreachable or down.</li> <li>The Jira instance is unreachable or down as the request timed out.</li> </ul> <p><b>Additional Notes:</b></p> <ul> <li>Every project in Jira has a workflow defined which consists of a set of states and transitions. Issues change states during their lifecycle by user action. Issues can be transitioned only into allowed states. <li>For example, for default project there are three pre-defined states: Todo, In Progress, Done.</li> In this example, workflow has following transitions available: <ul><li>ToDo -> In Progress</li> <li>In Progress -> ToDo or Done </li> <li>Done -> In Progress </li></ul> </ul> <p>To use this action, the corresponding Jira connection and credential must be created and associated with the Jira Connection & Credential alias. </p> <p><b>Note</b>: Requires a subscription for production use. <a target="_blank" href="https://docs.servicenow.com/?context=CSHelp:IntegrationHub-licensing-information">Read More</a>.</p>look_up_transitions[{"name":"{{action.issue_id}}","label":"action➛Issue
